verses.kjv: Then the word of the LORD came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to Jehu son of Hanani with a message against Baasha:

verses.kjv: Forasmuch as I exalted thee out of the dust, and made thee prince over my people Israel; and thou hast walked in the way of Jeroboam, and hast made my people Israel to sin, to provoke me to anger with their sins;
verses.web: “Because I exalted you out of the dust, and made you prince over my people Israel, and you have walked in the way of Jeroboam, and have made my people Israel to sin, to provoke me to anger with their sins;
verses.ct: "I lifted you up from nothing and made you ruler over my people Israel. But you followed the same path as Jeroboam and led my people Israel into sin, provoking my anger with their sins.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will take away the posterity of Baasha, and the posterity of his house; and will make thy house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
verses.web: behold, I will utterly sweep away Baasha and his house; and I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
verses.ct: So I am going to wipe out Baasha and his entire family. I will make your house end up just like the house of Jeroboam son of Nebat.

verses.kjv: Him that dieth of Baasha in the city shall the dogs eat; and him that dieth of his in the fields shall the fowls of the air eat.
verses.web: The dogs will eat Baasha’s descendants who die in the city; and he who dies of his in the field, the birds of the sky will eat.”
verses.ct: Any of Baasha's family who die in the city will be eaten by dogs, and any who die in the open country will be devoured by birds."

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Baasha, and what he did, and his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Baasha, and what he did, and his might, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Baasha's reign — what he did and the power he wielded — is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: So Baasha slept with his fathers, and was buried in Tirzah: and Elah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Baasha slept with his fathers, and was buried in Tirzah; and Elah his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Baasha died and was buried in Tirzah, and his son Elah became king after him.

verses.kjv: And also by the hand of the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani came the word of the LORD against Baasha, and against his house, even for all the evil that he did in the sight of the LORD, in provoking him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam; and because he killed him.
verses.web: Moreover LORD’s word came by the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha and against his house, both because of all the evil that he did in LORD’s sight, to provoke him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam, and because he struck him.
verses.ct: The LORD had spoken through the prophet Jehu son of Hanani against Baasha and his family — both because the LORD saw that he was evil, provoking God's anger through his actions by following the ways of Jeroboam's house, and also because he had destroyed Jeroboam's family.

verses.kjv: In the twenty and sixth year of Asa king of Judah began Elah the son of Baasha to reign over Israel in Tirzah, two years.
verses.web: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa king of Judah, Elah the son of Baasha began to reign over Israel in Tirzah for two years.
verses.ct: Elah son of Baasha became king of Israel in Tirzah during the 26th year of King Asa of Judah's reign, and he ruled for 2 years.

verses.kjv: And his servant Zimri, captain of half his chariots, conspired against him, as he was in Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza steward of his house in Tirzah.
verses.web: His servant Zimri, captain of half his chariots, conspired against him. Now he was in Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza, who was over the household in Tirzah;
verses.ct: One of his officials, Zimri, who commanded half of his chariot forces, plotted against him. While Elah was in Tirzah getting drunk at the house of Arza, the palace administrator,

verses.kjv: And Zimri went in and smote him, and killed him, in the twenty and seventh year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his stead.
verses.web: and Zimri went in and struck him, and killed him, in the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Zimri came in and struck him down and killed him. This happened in the 27th year of King Asa of Judah's reign, and Zimri took the throne.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he began to reign, as soon as he sat on his throne, that he slew all the house of Baasha: he left him not one that pisseth against a wall, neither of his kinsfolks, nor of his friends.
verses.web: When he began to reign, as soon as he sat on his throne, he attacked all the house of Baasha. He didn’t leave him a single one who urinates on a wall among his relatives or his friends.
verses.ct: The moment Zimri took power and sat on the throne, he slaughtered Baasha's entire family. He didn't spare a single male — not a relative, not even a friend.

verses.kjv: Thus did Zimri destroy all the house of Baasha, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake against Baasha by Jehu the prophet,
verses.web: Thus Zimri destroyed all the house of Baasha, according to LORD’s word, which he spoke against Baasha by Jehu the prophet,
verses.ct: Zimri wiped out the entire house of Baasha, exactly as the LORD had declared through the prophet Jehu.

verses.kjv: For all the sins of Baasha, and the sins of Elah his son, by which they sinned, and by which they made Israel to sin, in provoking the LORD God of Israel to anger with their vanities.
verses.web: for all the sins of Baasha, and the sins of Elah his son, which they sinned, and with which they made Israel to sin, to provoke LORD, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.
verses.ct: This happened because of all the sins of Baasha and his son Elah — sins they committed and led Israel to commit, provoking the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger with their worthless idols.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Elah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Elah, and all that he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Elah's reign and all that he did is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: In the twenty and seventh year of Asa king of Judah did Zimri reign seven days in Tirzah. And the people were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines.
verses.web: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, Zimri reigned seven days in Tirzah. Now the people were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines.
verses.ct: Zimri became king in Tirzah during the 27th year of King Asa of Judah's reign, but he ruled for only 7 days. At that time, the Israelite army was camped at Gibbethon, a Philistine city they were besieging.

verses.kjv: And the people that were encamped heard say, Zimri hath conspired, and hath also slain the king: wherefore all Israel made Omri, the captain of the host, king over Israel that day in the camp.
verses.web: The people who were encamped heard that Zimri had conspired, and had also killed the king. Therefore all Israel made Omri, the captain of the army, king over Israel that day in the camp.
verses.ct: When the soldiers in the camp heard that Zimri had conspired against the king and assassinated him, they proclaimed Omri, the army commander, as king of Israel right there in the camp that same day.

verses.kjv: And Omri went up from Gibbethon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged Tirzah.
verses.web: Omri went up from Gibbethon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged Tirzah.
verses.ct: Omri marched from Gibbethon with the entire Israelite army and laid siege to Tirzah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Zimri saw that the city was taken, that he went into the palace of the king’s house, and burnt the king’s house over him with fire, and died,
verses.web: When Zimri saw that the city was taken, he went into the fortified part of the king’s house, and burned the king’s house over him with fire, and died,
verses.ct: When Zimri saw that the city had fallen, he retreated into the inner fortress of the royal palace and set it on fire around himself. He died in the flames.

verses.kjv: For his sins which he sinned in doing evil in the sight of the LORD, in walking in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin which he did, to make Israel to sin.
verses.web: for his sins which he sinned in doing that which was evil in LORD’s sight, in walking in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin which he did, to make Israel to sin.
verses.ct: This was because of the sins he committed. The LORD saw that he was evil. He followed the same path as Jeroboam and led Israel into sin.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and his treason that he wrought, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and his treason that he committed, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Zimri's reign, including the conspiracy he carried out, is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: Then were the people of Israel divided into two parts: half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king; and half followed Omri.
verses.web: Then the people of Israel were divided into two parts: half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king; and half followed Omri.
verses.ct: After this, the people of Israel split into two factions: half supported Tibni son of Ginath and wanted to make him king, while the other half supported Omri.

verses.kjv: But the people that followed Omri prevailed against the people that followed Tibni the son of Ginath: so Tibni died, and Omri reigned.
verses.web: But the people who followed Omri prevailed against the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath; so Tibni died, and Omri reigned.
verses.ct: Omri's supporters overpowered those who backed Tibni son of Ginath. Tibni died, and Omri became king.

verses.kjv: In the thirty and first year of Asa king of Judah began Omri to reign over Israel, twelve years: six years reigned he in Tirzah.
verses.web: In the thirty-first year of Asa king of Judah, Omri began to reign over Israel for twelve years. He reigned six years in Tirzah.
verses.ct: Omri became king of Israel during the 31st year of King Asa of Judah's reign, and he ruled for 12 years. He spent the first 6 years ruling from Tirzah.

verses.kjv: And he bought the hill Samaria of Shemer for two talents of silver, and built on the hill, and called the name of the city which he built, after the name of Shemer, owner of the hill, Samaria.
verses.web: He bought the hill Samaria of Shemer for two talents of silver; and he built on the hill, and called the name of the city which he built Samaria, after the name of Shemer, the owner of the hill.
verses.ct: Then he purchased the hill of Samaria from Shemer for 2 talents of silver. He built a city on the hill and named it Samaria, after Shemer, the previous owner.

verses.kjv: But Omri wrought evil in the eyes of the LORD, and did worse than all that were before him.
verses.web: Omri did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, and dealt wickedly above all who were before him.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that Omri was evil — worse than any king of Israel before him.

verses.kjv: For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin, to provoke the LORD God of Israel to anger with their vanities.
verses.web: For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in his sins with which he made Israel to sin, to provoke LORD, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.
verses.ct: He followed every sinful practice of Jeroboam son of Nebat and led Israel into the same sins, provoking the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger with their worthless idols.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Omri which he did, and his might that he shewed, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Omri which he did, and his might that he showed, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Omri's reign — what he accomplished and the power he demonstrated — is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: So Omri slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria: and Ahab his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: So Omri slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria; and Ahab his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Omri died and was buried in Samaria, and his son Ahab became king after him.

verses.kjv: And in the thirty and eighth year of Asa king of Judah began Ahab the son of Omri to reign over Israel: and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty and two years.
verses.web: In the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah, Ahab the son of Omri began to reign over Israel. Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty-two years.
verses.ct: Ahab son of Omri became king of Israel during the 38th year of King Asa of Judah's reign, and he ruled Israel from Samaria for 22 years.

verses.kjv: And Ahab the son of Omri did evil in the sight of the LORD above all that were before him.
verses.web: Ahab the son of Omri did that which was evil in LORD’s sight above all that were before him.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that Ahab son of Omri was evil — more than any king of Israel before him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, that he took to wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Zidonians, and went and served Baal, and worshipped him.
verses.web: As if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, he took as wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Sidonians, and went and served Baal, and worshiped him.
verses.ct: As if following the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat weren't bad enough, he married Jezebel, the daughter of King Ethbaal of the Sidonians, and began worshiping and serving Baal.

verses.kjv: And he reared up an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.
verses.web: He raised up an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.
verses.ct: He built a temple for Baal in Samaria and set up an altar for Baal inside it.

verses.kjv: And Ahab made a grove; and Ahab did more to provoke the LORD God of Israel to anger than all the kings of Israel that were before him.
verses.web: Ahab made the Asherah; and Ahab did more yet to provoke LORD, the God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel who were before him.
verses.ct: Ahab also set up an Asherah pole. He did more to provoke the LORD, the God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel who came before him.

verses.kjv: In his days did Hiel the Bethelite build Jericho: he laid the foundation thereof in Abiram his firstborn, and set up the gates thereof in his youngest son Segub, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake by Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.web: In his days Hiel the Bethelite built Jericho. He laid its foundation with the loss of Abiram his firstborn, and set up its gates with the loss of his youngest son Segub, according to LORD’s word, which he spoke by Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.ct: During Ahab's reign, Hiel of Bethel rebuilt Jericho. When he laid its foundation, his firstborn son Abiram died, and when he set up its gates, his youngest son Segub died — exactly as the LORD had spoken through Joshua son of Nun.
